**The Central Scripture of the Nine Perfections of the Supreme Lord of the Great Clarity**

**Scripture Title:** *The Central Scripture of the Nine Perfections of the Supreme Lord of the Great Clarity* (abbreviated as *The Central Scripture of the Nine Perfections*). Author unknown, approximately composed during the mid-to-late Eastern Jin dynasty. One of the foundational scriptures of the early Highest Clarity (Shangqing) tradition. Originally in one scroll, later divided into two. Source text: *Daoist Canon of the Orthodox Tradition*, Zhengyi Section, First Division.

---

**The Central Scripture of the Nine Perfections of the Supreme Lord of the Great Clarity, Scroll One**

*Transmitted by the Perfected of the Great Void, the Supreme Immortal of Mount Nanyue, Master Red Pine (Chisongzi)*

**Esoteric Instructions of the Supreme Lord’s Scripture of the Nine Perfections**

The Central Yellow Venerable Lord is the younger brother of the Supreme Emperor of the Great Tenuity Heaven. In the second year of the Qingxu Shanghuang era, amidst primordial chaos, he was born. The radiance of the sun doubled its brilliance, its light intermingling with the numinous. Five-colored clouds formed a canopy, and auspicious mists settled in profound stillness.

At the age of seven, he already grasped the essentials of longevity and the methods of celestial immortality. With distant contemplation, he reverently embraced the mysterious and true. In solitude, his spirit dwelled in the wellspring of the divine. He embodied the eight absolutes, grasped emptiness to attain wholeness, freed himself from the nets of ornate entanglements, and roamed the unbounded expanse of the void. He delved into the obscure depths of the dark abyss, stood atop the towering waves of the mysterious, and guided his reins through the shifting paths. He clarified the myriad ways, illumined the cold winds of wondrous awakening, and soared hidden among the celestial clouds. He stirred the primordial at the edge of heaven, circulated the nine *qi* through the radiant ford, harmonized his refined rhythm with the orchid waves, and congealed purity in swirling stillness. Strange sounds echoed in the unseen, clouds gathered in the eight mists. He pondered the Great Beginning, his mind absorbed in the lofty image. He sought the paths of the ten directions, searched the spirits of the hidden origin, plucked the whirlwind to shake his brush, and concealed his purity in the subtle and obscure. His eyes opened the gate of the mysterious origin, his hands parted the courts of the myriad chambers. Gazing upward, he rejoiced in the divine craft; looking downward, he pitied the five hardships. He wandered in accord with his teachers, his insight profound and luminous. He cleansed his spirit’s brilliance, returning his thoughts to the true and numinous. Thus, the celestial melody wondrously arose, and karmic affinities mysteriously converged.

Thereupon, the Supreme One bestowed upon him the *Scripture of the Nine Perfections of the Supreme Lord*, along with the *Eight Esoteric Sayings of the Dao*. Through cultivation and attainment, he received the scripture and was named the Perfected of the Great Ultimate. Among the four Perfected of the Great Ultimate, the Central Yellow Venerable Lord stands to the left. He is adorned with the script of the Dark Dragon, the talisman of the Divine Tiger, a belt with golden bells, and holds the purple-furred staff. He wears a headscarf of golden essence. At times, he dons a crown of morning radiance, rides a flying dragon of dense splendor, and mounts the cloud of the Three Purities.

The *Eight Esoteric Sayings* state: Those who wish to practice the methods of the Nine Perfections must maintain a prolonged fast in a pure chamber. On the third day of the third month, the fifth day of the fifth month, the ninth day of the ninth month, and one’s own life-destiny day, one should bathe in east-flowing water infused with the five fragrances. On the night of the *jiazi* day, after bathing at midnight, burn incense to the left and right, face one’s life-destiny direction, bow twice in the heart, and pray:

*"Supreme Highest Perfected, Nine Numinous Radiant Essences,
Five Spirits of the Supreme Lord, Great One Returning to Clarity,
Grant that I ascend as a flying immortal to the Purple Court,
Bathe in the Flowery Pond, my body and spirit purified.
May the Peach Lord guard my destiny, the Supreme Lord return to infancy,
Ascend to the Great Void, my five viscera self-generated."*

The Supreme One said: Humans are formed by the binding of essence and the accumulation of *qi*, receiving the embryo and gathering blood. The obscure yellow and white congeal, the cinnabar and purple merge with mist. Thus, bones solidify, saliva is secreted, fluids disperse and flow. After four transformations and nine palaces unite, the five spirits command the body, and the Great One fixes their register. Suddenly, they stand; in an instant, they are complete. Without effort, they are fully formed; in a moment, they are born. Then the nine spirits enter and settle in their palaces. The five viscera mysteriously arise, and the five spirits preside over them.

Parents only know the beginning of my birth, unaware that the five spirits of the Supreme Lord have come to dwell within. The human body contains honored spirits whose abode is not fixed. They move in and out of the upper, middle, and lower *dantian*, alternating between *yin* and *yang*, shedding the old and absorbing the new, circulating and transporting the primordial essence.

The great spirit arises from the void within, forming the body. It irrigates the substance and refines it, transforming into radiant light—not like the three *hun* and seven *po*, which are accumulations of numinous *qi* born from one’s parents. The nine souls of the Supreme Lord transform their forms in an instant, suddenly becoming honored spirits with nine names, called the Nine Perfected Lords. This is the Great One, the Supreme Lord, merging and transforming as one.

Divided into upper and lower, they traverse the myriad paths. If you can cultivate them, you will emerge from water and enter fire, your five viscera perpetually regenerated. Maintain a prolonged fast and seclude yourself to preserve your true nature.

This text is also called *The Esoteric Instructions of the Nine Perfections*, *The Supreme Flying Writ*, *The Released Treasures of Foreign Lands*, and *The Numinous Chapters of the Divine Continent*. Though it bears four names, it is but one precious scripture.

**The First Perfection Method:** On the life-destiny day of the first month, or on the days of *jiazi* or *jiaxu* at dawn, the five spirits of the Supreme Lord and the Great One merge as one, transforming into a great spirit within the heart, named the Celestial Essence Lord, styled *Flying Life, Supreme Hero*, with the appearance of a newborn infant.

On that day at dawn, enter your chamber, place your hands upon your knees, hold your breath, close your eyes, and inwardly visualize the Celestial Essence Lord seated within your heart, calling him the Great Spirit. Have the Great Spirit exhale purple *qi* in abundance, swirling ninefold around the outside of your heart. The *qi* ascends to pierce the Mud Pill Palace, uniting inner and outer as one.

When complete, click your teeth nine times, swallow your saliva nine times, and pray:

*"Celestial Essence Great Lord, Flying Life, Supreme Hero,
The Supreme Lord inwardly transforms, appearing within my heart.
Clad in crimson robes, crowned with a cinnabar cap,
Left bearing the Dragon Script, right adorned with the Tiger Talisman,
Harmonizing essence in the Three Paths, uniting spirit with the Upper Origin.
Five numina hold the talisman, completing the union with the Supreme Lord.
Exhaling purple blossoms, nourishing the heart and congealing spirit,
The Red Visceral Palace self-generates, attaining flight as an immortal."*

When finished, repeat the practice at midnight, following the same method. This is the natural merging and transformation of the five spirits of the Supreme Lord, becoming one great spirit in due time.

What is called "spontaneous alignment with life" no longer requires awaiting signs or meditative visualization to achieve. The Second True Method: On the day of one’s life-star in the third month, or on an *jiǎ-shēn* day at the *chén* hour, the Supreme Lord and Great One unite with the five spirits, merging and transforming inwardly to become one great spirit. This great spirit disperses its form and scatters its *qi*, filling all the joints, and is named the *Firm Jade Lord*. At this time, enter the chamber, place your hands upon your knees, hold your breath, close your eyes, and inwardly focus your vision. Visualize the *Firm Jade Lord*, whose name is *Congealed Feather Pearl*, entering and sitting within the throat’s gastric tube, transforming into white *qi* that permeates the hundred bones. Envision the great spirit exhaling white *qi* to encircle the bones ninefold, both within and without dense as misty clouds. When complete, click your teeth nine times, swallow your saliva nine times, and pray:

*"Firm Jade Great Lord, enter my bones,
Clad in plain robes, crowned with a white cap,
Your name, Congealed Feather Pearl, nourishes the nine gates.
Left bearing the Dragon Script, right adorned with Golden Perfection,
Exhaling white qi, strengthening bones and congealing sinews,
White bones never decay, sinews never dissolve,
A hundred joints bloom with blossoms, enabling me to fly as an immortal."*

When finished, repeat the practice at the midnight hour of *qi*-generation. On the ninth true day, the Supreme Lord and Great One’s five spirits naturally merge and transform, instantly becoming one great spirit, no longer requiring prior signs or visualization to complete the union. Its form resembles that of an infant, and the nine true methods follow the same pattern. This is the nine *hún* and seven *pò* transforming the five spirits into a congealed union, the Supreme Lord’s ninefold metamorphosis. The Great One and Three Dipper Stars together grasp the talismanic register, determining the mysterious and pure record, enabling the practitioner to attain long life without death and ascend to the immortal courts. This Dao is profound and secret, treasured by the highest spirits. Those without immortal registers may not hear of it; those without prior karmic affinity may not witness it. Those who hear or see it are born in accord with destiny, attaining union with the numinous. Thus, through hidden resonance and auspicious convergence, they are delivered from obscurity and comprehend the subtle. Heavenly spirits descend, jade blossoms greet their gaze, so the nine truths firm the heart, and the eight paths awaken insight. This is the union of the Three Origins’ talismans, not something sought by those who walk the earthly path. First, make a covenant oath, then may it be proclaimed.

The Third True Method: On the day of one’s life-star in the fourth month, or on an *jiǎ-wǔ* or *dīng-mǎo* day at the *sì* hour, the Supreme Lord and Great One’s five spirits merge and transform to generate a great spirit. This great spirit suddenly disperses its form, becoming a dense yellow *qi* that flows into all the essence and blood, named the *Primal Life Lord*, whose name is *Yellow Tranquility Master of Mystery*. At the *sì* hour, enter the chamber, place your hands upon your knees, hold your breath, close your eyes, and inwardly focus your vision. Visualize the *Primal Life Lord* circulating through the body’s blood vessels and essence-fluids, exhaling yellow *qi* to envelop and permeate the external pores and meridians, as well as the body’s ninefold layers, so that within and without are suffused with yellow *qi*. When complete, click your teeth nine times, swallow your saliva nine times, and pray:

*"Primal Life Great Lord, together irrigate this blood-body,
Clad in yellow robes, crowned with a purple lotus,
Left bearing the Tiger Record, right adorned with the Dragon Script,
Feathered robes draped above, majestic presence upheld,
Exhaling yellow essence, securing the blood and stabilizing the void,
True qi enters daily, evil qi dissolves,
Essence brims, fluids overflow, the nine numina all reside,
Enabling me to fly as an immortal, in harmony with Heaven and Earth."*

When finished, repeat the practice at the midnight hour of *qi*-generation.

The Fourth True Method: On an *jiǎ-chén* day, one’s life-star day, or a *wù-yín* day at the *wǔ* hour in the sixth month, the Supreme Lord and Great One’s five spirits transform into one great spirit, entering the liver, named the *Azure Clarity Lord*, whose name is *Luminous Wheel Youth*. On this day at the *wǔ* hour, enter the chamber, place your hands upon your knees, hold your breath, close your eyes, and inwardly focus your vision. Visualize the *Azure Clarity Great Lord* entering and sitting within the liver, exhaling azure *qi* to encircle the liver ninefold. When complete, click your teeth nine times, swallow your saliva nine times, and pray:

*"Azure Clarity Great Lord, enter my liver,
Clad in azure robes, crowned with a kingfisher cap,
Left bearing the Tiger Seal, right adorned with the Dragon Script,
Your name, Luminous Wheel Youth, treasured true clarity,
Exhaling azure qi, nourishing the liver and guiding the spirit,
The Azure Visceral Palace self-generates, ascending as a celestial immortal,
The Great One guards essence, embracing the *pò* and restraining the *hún*,
The Supreme Lord presents the register, enabling me to attain the true."*

When finished, repeat the practice at the midnight hour of *qi*-generation.

The Fifth True Method: On the third day of the seventh month, or on one’s life-star day or a *gēng-wǔ* day at the *sì* hour, the Supreme Lord and Great One’s five spirits merge and transform into one great spirit within the spleen, named the *Nurturing Radiance Lord*, whose name is *Great Granary Master*. At this time, the practitioner enters the chamber, places their hands upon their knees, holds their breath, closes their eyes, and inwardly focuses their vision. Visualize the *Nurturing Radiance Lord* entering and sitting within the spleen, exhaling green *qi* to encircle the spleen ninefold, the *qi* ascending to the *Mud Pill Palace*, within and without thoroughly suffused. When complete, click your teeth nine times, swallow your saliva nine times, and pray:

*"Nurturing Radiance Great Lord, enter my spleen,
Irrigating the Three Origins above, this is the Great Granary,
Clad in green robes, crowned with a lotus cap,
Left bearing Jade Numinosity, right adorned with Majestic Spirit,
The Five Numinous hold axes, seven lightning bolts and nine thunderclaps,
Exhaling green blossoms, nourishing the spleen and settling the *hún*,
The Yellow Visceral Palace self-generates, ascending as a perfected one."*

When finished, repeat the practice at the midnight hour of *qi*-generation.

The Sixth True Method: On the fifteenth day of the eighth month, or on one’s life-star day or a *gēng-shēn* day at the *shēn* hour, the Supreme Lord and Great One’s five spirits merge and transform into one great spirit within the lungs, named the *Upper Origin Plain Jade Lord*, whose name is *Liáng of the Southern Center Youth*. At this time, the practitioner enters the chamber, places their hands upon their knees, holds their breath, closes their eyes, and inwardly focuses their vision. Visualize the *Upper Origin Plain Jade Lord* entering and sitting within the lungs, exhaling five-colored *qi* to encircle the lungs ninefold, ascending to the *Mud Pill Palace*, within and without dense and luminous.

When finished, strike the teeth nine times, swallow saliva nine times, and recite the incantation:

*"Upper Origin Great Lord, come and sit within the lungs.
Liáng of the Three Heavens’ Southern Center, Radiant Flower Central Youth,
clad in dragon robes, crowned with the Yellow Dawn’s splendor,
right hand grasping the Imperial Register, the Supreme Lord sharing the wheel,
the Great One holding the Chart, right hand wielding the Sacred Scroll,
left side bearing the Mystic Writ, right side girded with Tiger Script,
mouth exhaling fivefold qi."*

Repeat the practice at this time.

The Seventh True Method: On the nineteenth day of the ninth month, or on one’s life-star day or a *wù-xū* day at the *yǒu* hour, the Supreme Lord and Great One’s five spirits merge and transform into one great spirit, which suddenly divides into two, dispersing to sit within the two kidneys. They are named the *Mysterious Yang Lord*, with the style *Master of Dark Radiance*. At this appointed time, the practitioner enters the chamber, places their hands upon their knees, closes their eyes, holds their breath, and inwardly focuses their vision. Visualize the *Mysterious Yang Lord* transforming and entering the two kidneys, exhaling azure *qi* to encircle the kidneys ninefold, ascending to pierce the *Mud Pill Palace*, within and without dense and luminous.

When finished, strike the teeth nine times, swallow saliva nine times, and recite the incantation:

*"Mysterious Yang Supreme Lord, enter and sit within the kidneys,
clad in purple robes, head wrapped in the Dawn’s sash,
left side bearing the Dragon Talisman, right side girded with Phoenix Script.
Master of Dark Radiance, ever before the Supreme Lord,
mouth exhaling azure blossoms to irrigate the kidneys’ numinous root.
The Most High lingers, above welcoming the Supreme Lord,
below inscribing my name in the ledgers.
Black *qi* nurtures spontaneous generation,
the body becomes a flying immortal,
ascending north to the Mysterious Gate,
roaming the Celestial Pass,
striding the Upper Void,
hand in hand with the five spirits."*

When finished, repeat the practice at the midnight hour of *qi*-generation.

The Eighth True Method: On the twelfth day of the tenth month, or on one’s life-star day or a *xīn-sì* day at the *wǔ* hour, the Supreme Lord and Great One’s five spirits merge and transform into one great spirit within the gallbladder, named the *Containing Radiance Lord*, with the style *Mysterious Essence of the Northern Terrace*. At this appointed time, the practitioner enters the chamber, places their hands upon their knees, holds their breath, closes their eyes, and inwardly focuses their vision. Visualize the *Containing Radiance Lord* entering and sitting within the gallbladder, exhaling five-colored *qi* to encircle the gallbladder ninefold, ascending to pierce the *Mud Pill Palace*, clouds and mist dense and luminous within and without.

When finished, strike the teeth nine times, swallow saliva nine times, and recite the incantation:

*"Containing Radiance Great Lord, come and sit within the gallbladder,
clad in brocade robes, crowned with a purple coronet.
Mysterious Essence of the Northern Terrace, transforming to generate numinous mist,
left side bearing Divine Radiance, right side girded with Jade Perfection,
mouth exhaling fivefold *qi* to nourish the gallbladder and strengthen the body.
The Three Commands of the Supreme Emperor bind me in kinship.
Peach Lord records the talisman, the Great One’s Seven Arrays,
harmonizing essence, treasuring blood, governing fluids, and fortifying sinews.
May I ascend above to become a flying immortal,
northward to attend the Void Sovereign,
riding the chariot of the Three Origins."*

When finished, repeat the practice at the midnight hour of *qi*-generation.

The Ninth True Method: On the twenty-eighth day of the eleventh month, or on one’s life-star day or a *bǐng-zǐ* day at the *sì* hour, the Supreme Lord and Great One’s five spirits merge and transform into one great spirit within the Purple Chamber of the *Mud Pill Palace*, named the *Supreme Prosperity August Lord*, with the style *Primordial Spirit of the First Numen*. This spirit is the ancestral father of the Supreme Lord, thus from nine transformations the merged souls revert to the ancestral form, descending into the Upper Palace. As the immortal writ declares: "To unbind the knots within the womb, none but the ancestor can disperse and transform them; none but the father can uproot them; none but the Supreme Lord can rectify the soul." Therefore, the ancestor and father must come to cultivate and stabilize the form and spirit for eternal endurance.

At each appointed time, the practitioner should bathe, burn incense to the left and right, enter the chamber, and sit upright, placing their hands upon their knees. Visualize the *Supreme Prosperity August Lord* within the Purple Chamber of the *Mud Pill Palace*, exhaling purple *qi* to encircle the head ninefold. When finished, exhale purple *qi* to encircle the eyes’ inner and outer aspects ninefold. When finished, exhale purple *qi* to encircle the tongue ninefold. When finished, exhale purple *qi* to encircle the teeth ninefold. In all, four sets of nine—thirty-six encirclings of *qi*—so that the entire body, within and without, becomes dense and luminous, suffused as if the sun dwells within.

When all is complete, strike the teeth thirty-six times, swallow saliva thirty-six times, and recite the incantation:

*"August Ancestral Lord of Supreme Prosperity, Primordial Spirit of the Imperial Sovereign,
enthroned within the Purple Chamber, palace of the Mud Pill,
Yellow Gate and Golden Chamber, merging the nine souls,
souls generating myriad transformations to become the Supreme Lord.
Five spirits attend in service, the Seven *Qi* of the Upper Perfected,
dragon robes and phoenix mantle, purple and emerald, azure and green,
hand grasping the Imperial Talisman, head crowned with a radiant coronet,
left side bearing Jade Luminance, right side girded with Tiger Script,
seated below the sun and moon, mouth exhaling purple mist,
encircling teeth and tongue, irrigating eyes and lips,
issuing cinnabar and entering the void, summoning *po* and calling *hun*,
congealing essence and securing the womb, the Six Harmonies in eternal joy.
Ascend to the Great Subtlety, ranked among the immortal officials."*

Thus, the Nine True Methods of the year are complete. Cycling through them anew, the *Mud Pill Palace* governs the numinous, the Eye Youths attain full clarity, the five viscera generate spontaneously, and the blood and vessels preserve their fluids. Should the body not yet ascend and merge with the dawn, it is fitting to conceal one’s radiance and appear mundane, temporarily entering the Great Yin. For those whose bodies have passed through the Three Offices, the Three Offices cannot transgress. The Nine Perfected summon the *po*, the Great One guards the skeleton, the Three Origins protect the *qi*, the Great One gathers the *hun*. Bones and flesh do not decay, the five viscera do not perish. One can die and live, be yin and yang, emerge from the void and enter nonbeing, coexisting with heaven and earth.

Thus, when Daoists cultivate stillness to nurture the form, the *qi* of the Nine Perfected responds. The Three Origins’ flying essence fills and empties, the Great One embraces my corpse to return to its original substance. Subtle indeed, profound indeed! Those who constantly practice the Nine True Methods shall have a hundred spirits bow in obeisance and ten thousand ghosts receive their commands.

Should one pass through the Great Yin, the form and bones shall not decay, the five viscera shall regenerate of themselves. After twenty-four years, one shall attain rebirth. Suddenly awakening, clearly perceiving—vividly recalling the entry into the Great Yin as though it were but a night’s slumber. Startled, one finds oneself already beyond the coffin and outer casket; radiantly, one sits atop the mountain’s peak. Such is the subtle mystery of the Nine Perfected, the utmost divinity of the Lord Emperor.

Those who practice this Dao must speak sparingly and still the heart, their words never touching upon death, their conduct upright and free from excess, their speech never veering toward sensuality. They must also cherish *qi* to nurture the spirit, maintain composed movements, hold the breath to its utmost, exhale gently, emerging from the void and entering nonbeing in an unbroken, continuous flow. This is where the Lord Emperor abides, where the Mysterious Mother draws near—by this, one may preserve the Five Spirits and invoke the Nine Perfected.

**The Supreme Lord Emperor’s Nine Perfected Treasure Talisman** *(original talisman omitted)*
This talisman should be written in cinnabar on the eight solar terms and ingested.

The Perfected of the Great Ultimate says: One should recite it silently, chanting it thrice at dawn and midnight on the new and full moons to harmonize the Nine *Hun*, restore the *qi* of the Emperor’s Chamber, rectify the human spirit, dispel evil, open the hundred passages, and bring clarity. This is a precious secret—do not recklessly disclose it. This is what is called the *Dragon Script of the Three Heavens*.

The Supreme Nine Perfected compose the Dragon Script; the Lord Emperor’s divine court makes the body its home. The Heavenly Honored One dwells in the Crimson Chamber, residing in the Hall of Light, seated upright in the Great Ultimate, the Mysterious Cinnabar unerring. The Mysterious Mother rides the Three Primordial Essences’ chariot; the Primordial Father reins the crimson-feathered flying carriage. To the left, the scarlet phoenix guides; to the right, the numinous crow steers. A square inch of true alignment gathers the spirits of the Upper Realm. The Cinnabar Terrace and Flame Tower scatter radiance into the void, soaring high in the Supreme Tenuity. In hand, the Purple Register; the numinous abyss and pristine pool brim with golden nectar and liquid jade. The Nine *Qi* linger and circle; flying blossoms and leaping clouds. Within dwells a great spirit, beyond naming.

The Father drives the primordial *qi*; the Mother bears the mysterious axle. The sun’s essence crowns the head; the tiger’s register girds the waist. Streams of fire stretch ten thousand *zhang*; eyes blaze with dragon candles. The Heavenly Emperor holds the tally; phoenix robes and feathered regalia adorn the body. Constantly abiding in the Nine Perfected, nurtured by the Divine Emperor, one resides in the Purple Chamber, north of the Hall of Light. Bathing life to renew essence, guarding the Mysterious Valley, entering and exiting the Chamber of Destiny, roaming the Cavern Pass, at times entering the Central Palace, ascending to the Great Origin. Lingering amidst the Four *Qi*, the Nine Stars divide and disperse. The five viscera flourish; the Great One guards the *hun*. Resting in the secluded court, commanding the Seven Spirits—should you chant this, you shall ascend at dawn.

Through refined resonance and wondrous response, you shall harness and ride the numinous beasts. Mountains crumble, waters surge—call out, and they shall answer with thunderous aid. At the appointed hour of the living earth, you shall ascend to the celestial lodgings. When the Nine Perfected Dao is complete, to leak it brings calamity. The Three Offices will unleash their poisons, meting out punishment for divulgence. Transmit it only to those of immortal potential, carefully assessing their capacity for accomplishment.

**The Eight Secret Sayings of the Yellow Elder Lord of the Central Palace**
The secret words whisper: Still the heart in a tranquil chamber, vast and empty, serene and true. Let lofty contemplation and wondrous vision soar and bathe the Mysterious Person. If sincerity summons the celestial convergence and essence awakens to the radiant dawn, you shall behold the *qi* of the Cinnabar Effulgence, the Three Primordial Essences’ flying clouds, the eight chariots and crimson carriages, the purple auroras and jade wheels. The Upper Clarity floats in gaze; the Three Origins circle in reins. The High Sovereign holds the tally; the numinous youths grasp the shafts. The Primordial Simplicity bears the canopy; the Southern Culmen leans upon the carriage. The Lord Emperor guards the chamber; the Five Spirits of the Conjoined Effulgence and the Seven *Qi* of continuous brightness intertwine. Lofty radiance coils afar; obscure light reflects outward. The dragon countenance glows dimly; the image illuminates the Great Void. The Seven Observances flow and drift.

Should you diligently await this, you shall ascend as an immortal in broad daylight. Should the cloud chariot suddenly descend, you shall ascend at dawn without need for further refinement—no frost to congeal, no blossoms to bathe, no mysterious marrow or golden elixir.

**First Secret Saying:**
On the day of *Lichun* (Beginning of Spring), during the *jia* or *yi* days of the first month, at dawn, gaze northward. If you see clouds of purple, green, and white, these are the Three Primordial Essences’ flying clouds of the Supreme Three Origin Lords. At that time, the Three Origin Lords ride the Eight Chariots to ascend to the Heavenly Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign. Should you await and witness these three-colored clouds, concentrate your mind, bow, and strike your breast. Mentally, bow four times and declare: *"Your humble descendant, so-and-so, from youth has cherished the Dao and virtue, cultivating the Nine Perfected, bathing the Five Spirits, all recorded by the Heavenly Emperor and the Lord Emperor. Today, by great fortune, I encounter the Three Origin Lords’ procession. I humbly beseech to attend and serve at the wheel’s hub, to offer any prayer or wish."* Should you thrice witness the Lords’ chariots, you shall ascend as an immortal in broad daylight, no longer requiring other visualizations or myriad practices.

**Second Secret Saying:**
On the day of the *Chunfen* (Spring Equinox) and the *yin* or *mao* days, at midnight, gaze northeast. If you see clouds of dark green and yellow, these are the Three Primordial Essences’ clouds of the Lord Emperor of the Supreme Tenuity. At that time, the Lord Emperor of the Supreme Tenuity rides the Eight Effulgences’ chariot to ascend to the Highest Jade Sovereign. Should you witness this, concentrate your mind, bow, and pray as above. Should you four times witness the Emperor’s chariot, at dawn, a dragon carriage with feathered canopy shall come to welcome you, ascending to heaven.

**Third Secret Saying:**
On the day of *Lixia* (Beginning of Summer) and the *wu-chen* or *ji-si* days of the first *jiazi* decade, at dawn, gaze northwest. If you see clouds of purple, green, and yellow, these are the Three Primordial Essences’ clouds of the Supreme Perfected of the Great Ultimate and the Three Origin Perfected of the Inner Palace. At that time, the Supreme Perfected of the Great Ultimate and the Three Origin Perfected ride the Mysterious Effulgence’s green chariot to ascend to the Purple Tenuity Palace. Pray and bow as above. Should you five times witness the Great Ultimate’s chariot, you shall ascend as an immortal in broad daylight.

**Fourth Secret Saying:**
On the day of the *Xiazhi* (Summer Solstice) and the *wu-yin* or *ji-mao* days of the *jia-xu* decade, at dawn, gaze southeast. If you see clouds of red, white, and green, these are the Three Primordial Essences’ clouds of the Great Emperor Lord of Fusang.

At that time, the Great Emperor Lord of Fusang, riding the luminous chariot of the Eightfold Radiance, ascends to the Supreme Subtlety Palace. Upon seeing this, pray and bow in your heart as in the method above. Should you witness it four times, clouds and dragons shall appear to welcome you, and you shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

**Fifth Secret Saying:**
On the day of *Liqu* (Beginning of Autumn) and the *wu-zi* or *ji-chou* days of the *jia-shen* decade, at dawn, gaze due west. If you see clouds of white, red, and purple, these are the Three Primordial Essences’ clouds of the Supreme Perfected of the Great Primordial and the Heavenly Thearch White Emperor. At that time, the Supreme Perfected White Emperor rides the jade carriage of ethereal grace to ascend to the Jade Heaven’s Mysterious August Perfected. You should pray and bow, entreating as in the method above. Should you witness it five times, you shall ascend as an immortal in broad daylight.

On the day of the *Dongzhi* (Winter Solstice) and the *wu-wu* or *ji-wei* days of the *jia-yin* decade, at dawn, gaze due east. The Thearch’s two youths swiftly arise,
Entering the Mud-Pill at dawn,
Refining the brain and treasuring the form.
Left transforms, right transmutes,
Attaining the name of the Dao.
May I ascend to audience
In the Purple Clarity of the Great Primordial."*

Visualize the two youths emerging from your eyes, allowing the green qi to suddenly transform and bring them into being. Keep them at your sides, and have the two youths each exhale green qi to envelop and permeate your entire body, penetrating within and without.

*The Jade Dawn’s Yellow Effulgence Scripture of the Flowing Moon*

Round blossom, ninefold brightness,
Great light dawns, morning’s splendor,
Resplendent with vermilion essence.
Five Emperors rise in mist,
Illuminating the myriad beings of the cavernous void.

Empty and boundless, harmonious and level.

Flowing through the five forms.

Cloud toads refine and polish,

Timely riding the flowing bell,
Ten dragons of flying clouds,

chunks.original_text: 上清太上帝君九真中经 经名：上清太上帝君九真中经。 简称《九真中经》。 撰人不详，约出於东晋南期。 为早期上清派重要经典之一。 原本一卷。 后分作二卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》正一部。 上清太上帝君九真中经卷上 太虚真人南岳上仙赤松子传 太上帝君九真中经内诀 中央黄老君者，太上太微天帝君之弟也。 以清虚上皇二年，混尔始生，日晖重曜，连光映灵，五云翳盖，庆烟玄停。 年七岁，仍自知长生之要，天仙之法，乃眇纶上思，钦纳玄真，萧条灵想，心栖神源，广体八绝，握空投全，解脱於文蔚之罗，披素於空住之肆，浩洲黯探，玄波云峙，总辔遁迁，澄理万涂，焕冷风於妙觉，隐摽霄以游盘，激玄元於天外，运九气於霞津，逸韵兰波，凝清渟旋，奇音冥响，云会八烟，理玩太初，冥心高象，希涂十方，搜神幽元，掇飙振毫，潜素隐微，目豁玄元之户，手披万寝之庭，仰欣神匠，俯悲五难，流浪师契，窈窕明机，濯易神颖，归想真灵，尔乃天韵妙蔼，宿会玄感。 於是太上授以帝君九真之经，八道秘言之章，施修道成，受书为太极真人。 太极有四真人，中央黄老君处其左，得佩龙玄之文，神虎之符，带流金之铃，执紫毛之节，巾金精之巾。 或扶晨华冠，驾郁华飞龙，乘三素之云。 八道秘言曰：欲行九真之法者，长斋清室，常以三月三日、五月五日、九月九日，及本命日，用东流水沐浴五香之气，又以甲子日夜半沐浴毕，烧香於左右，向本命，心再拜，心祝曰： 太上高真，九灵景精，帝君五神，太一归明，使我飞仙，上登紫庭，沐浴华池，身神澄清，桃君守命，帝君反婴，上通太虚，五藏自生。 太上曰：夫人唯结精积气，受胎敛血，黄白幽凝，丹紫合烟，所以凝骨吐津，散布流液，四度会化，九宫一结，五神命其形躯，太一定其符籍，忽尔而立，怳尔而成，罔尔而具，脱尔而生，於是乃九神来入，安在其宫，五藏玄生，五神主焉。 父母唯知生育之始我也，而不觉帝君五神，来适於其间也。 人体有尊神，其居无常，出入乎上中下三田，回易阴阳，去故纳新，展转荣输，流注元津。 大神虚生内结，以成一身，灌质化炼，变景光明，非如三魂七魄，是积灵受气，自生於人父母者也。 帝君九魂，变形一时，忽为尊神，有九名，号曰九真君，此太一帝君之混合而一变也。 分为上下，旁适万道，子能修之，则出水入火，五脏常生，长斋隐栖，以存其真。 此文一名九真内诀，一名太上飞文，一名外国放品，一名神州灵章，虽有四名，故一宝书耳。 第一真法，以正月本命日，甲子、甲戍日平旦，帝君太一五神，壹共混合，变为一大神，在心之内，号曰天精君，字飞生上英，貌如婴儿始生之状。 是其日平旦，当入室，接手於两膝上，闭气冥目内视，存天精君坐在心中，号曰大神。 使大神口出紫气郁然，以绕我心外九重，气上冲泥丸中，内外如一。 毕，因叩齿九通，咽液九过，祝曰： 天精大君，飞生上英，帝君内化，来见心中，身披朱衣，头巾丹冠，左佩龙书，右带虎文，和精三道，合神上元，五灵奉符，与帝同全，口吐紫华，养心凝神，赤藏自生，得为飞仙。 毕，夜半复行之，如上法。 此是帝君五神，应时自然混变，为一大神耳。

**The Central Scripture of the Nine Perfections of the Supreme Lord of the Great Clarity**

**Scripture Title:** *The Central Scripture of the Nine Perfections of the Supreme Lord of the Great Clarity* (abbreviated as *The Central Scripture of the Nine Perfections*). Author unknown, approximately composed during the mid-to-late Eastern Jin dynasty. One of the foundational scriptures of the early Highest Clarity (Shangqing) tradition. Originally in one scroll, later divided into two. Source text: *Daoist Canon of the Orthodox Tradition*, Zhengyi Section, First Division.

---

**The Central Scripture of the Nine Perfections of the Supreme Lord of the Great Clarity, Scroll One**

*Transmitted by the Perfected of the Great Void, the Supreme Immortal of Mount Nanyue, Master Red Pine (Chisongzi)*

**Esoteric Instructions of the Supreme Lord’s Scripture of the Nine Perfections**

The Central Yellow Venerable Lord is the younger brother of the Supreme Emperor of the Great Tenuity Heaven. In the second year of the Qingxu Shanghuang era, amidst primordial chaos, he was born. The radiance of the sun doubled its brilliance, its light intermingling with the numinous. Five-colored clouds formed a canopy, and auspicious mists settled in profound stillness.

At the age of seven, he already grasped the essentials of longevity and the methods of celestial immortality. With distant contemplation, he reverently embraced the mysterious and true. In solitude, his spirit dwelled in the wellspring of the divine. He embodied the eight absolutes, grasped emptiness to attain wholeness, freed himself from the nets of ornate entanglements, and roamed the unbounded expanse of the void. He delved into the obscure depths of the dark abyss, stood atop the towering waves of the mysterious, and guided his reins through the shifting paths. He clarified the myriad ways, illumined the cold winds of wondrous awakening, and soared hidden among the celestial clouds. He stirred the primordial at the edge of heaven, circulated the nine *qi* through the radiant ford, harmonized his refined rhythm with the orchid waves, and congealed purity in swirling stillness. Strange sounds echoed in the unseen, clouds gathered in the eight mists. He pondered the Great Beginning, his mind absorbed in the lofty image. He sought the paths of the ten directions, searched the spirits of the hidden origin, plucked the whirlwind to shake his brush, and concealed his purity in the subtle and obscure. His eyes opened the gate of the mysterious origin, his hands parted the courts of the myriad chambers. Gazing upward, he rejoiced in the divine craft; looking downward, he pitied the five hardships. He wandered in accord with his teachers, his insight profound and luminous. He cleansed his spirit’s brilliance, returning his thoughts to the true and numinous. Thus, the celestial melody wondrously arose, and karmic affinities mysteriously converged.

Thereupon, the Supreme One bestowed upon him the *Scripture of the Nine Perfections of the Supreme Lord*, along with the *Eight Esoteric Sayings of the Dao*. Through cultivation and attainment, he received the scripture and was named the Perfected of the Great Ultimate. Among the four Perfected of the Great Ultimate, the Central Yellow Venerable Lord stands to the left. He is adorned with the script of the Dark Dragon, the talisman of the Divine Tiger, a belt with golden bells, and holds the purple-furred staff. He wears a headscarf of golden essence. At times, he dons a crown of morning radiance, rides a flying dragon of dense splendor, and mounts the cloud of the Three Purities.

The *Eight Esoteric Sayings* state: Those who wish to practice the methods of the Nine Perfections must maintain a prolonged fast in a pure chamber. On the third day of the third month, the fifth day of the fifth month, the ninth day of the ninth month, and one’s own life-destiny day, one should bathe in east-flowing water infused with the five fragrances. On the night of the *jiazi* day, after bathing at midnight, burn incense to the left and right, face one’s life-destiny direction, bow twice in the heart, and pray:

*"Supreme Highest Perfected, Nine Numinous Radiant Essences,
Five Spirits of the Supreme Lord, Great One Returning to Clarity,
Grant that I ascend as a flying immortal to the Purple Court,
Bathe in the Flowery Pond, my body and spirit purified.
May the Peach Lord guard my destiny, the Supreme Lord return to infancy,
Ascend to the Great Void, my five viscera self-generated."*

The Supreme One said: Humans are formed by the binding of essence and the accumulation of *qi*, receiving the embryo and gathering blood. The obscure yellow and white congeal, the cinnabar and purple merge with mist. Thus, bones solidify, saliva is secreted, fluids disperse and flow. After four transformations and nine palaces unite, the five spirits command the body, and the Great One fixes their register. Suddenly, they stand; in an instant, they are complete. Without effort, they are fully formed; in a moment, they are born. Then the nine spirits enter and settle in their palaces. The five viscera mysteriously arise, and the five spirits preside over them.

Parents only know the beginning of my birth, unaware that the five spirits of the Supreme Lord have come to dwell within. The human body contains honored spirits whose abode is not fixed. They move in and out of the upper, middle, and lower *dantian*, alternating between *yin* and *yang*, shedding the old and absorbing the new, circulating and transporting the primordial essence.

The great spirit arises from the void within, forming the body. It irrigates the substance and refines it, transforming into radiant light—not like the three *hun* and seven *po*, which are accumulations of numinous *qi* born from one’s parents. The nine souls of the Supreme Lord transform their forms in an instant, suddenly becoming honored spirits with nine names, called the Nine Perfected Lords. This is the Great One, the Supreme Lord, merging and transforming as one.

Divided into upper and lower, they traverse the myriad paths. If you can cultivate them, you will emerge from water and enter fire, your five viscera perpetually regenerated. Maintain a prolonged fast and seclude yourself to preserve your true nature.

This text is also called *The Esoteric Instructions of the Nine Perfections*, *The Supreme Flying Writ*, *The Released Treasures of Foreign Lands*, and *The Numinous Chapters of the Divine Continent*. Though it bears four names, it is but one precious scripture.

**The First Perfection Method:** On the life-destiny day of the first month, or on the days of *jiazi* or *jiaxu* at dawn, the five spirits of the Supreme Lord and the Great One merge as one, transforming into a great spirit within the heart, named the Celestial Essence Lord, styled *Flying Life, Supreme Hero*, with the appearance of a newborn infant.

On that day at dawn, enter your chamber, place your hands upon your knees, hold your breath, close your eyes, and inwardly visualize the Celestial Essence Lord seated within your heart, calling him the Great Spirit. Have the Great Spirit exhale purple *qi* in abundance, swirling ninefold around the outside of your heart. The *qi* ascends to pierce the Mud Pill Palace, uniting inner and outer as one.

When complete, click your teeth nine times, swallow your saliva nine times, and pray:

*"Celestial Essence Great Lord, Flying Life, Supreme Hero,
The Supreme Lord inwardly transforms, appearing within my heart.
Clad in crimson robes, crowned with a cinnabar cap,
Left bearing the Dragon Script, right adorned with the Tiger Talisman,
Harmonizing essence in the Three Paths, uniting spirit with the Upper Origin.
Five numina hold the talisman, completing the union with the Supreme Lord.
Exhaling purple blossoms, nourishing the heart and congealing spirit,
The Red Visceral Palace self-generates, attaining flight as an immortal."*

When finished, repeat the practice at midnight, following the same method. This is the natural merging and transformation of the five spirits of the Supreme Lord, becoming one great spirit in due time.

chunks.original_text: 所谓触节顺生者矣，不复待兆存念而成之也。 第二真法，以三月本命日，及甲申日辰时，帝君太一合会五神，混化内变，为一大神。 大神分形散气，尽布在诸骨节中，号曰坚玉君。 是其时也，当入室，接手於两膝上，闭气冥目，注心内视，存坚玉君，字凝羽珠，入坐喉下胃管中，化白气以入诸百骨节中。 存大神口吐白气，以绕骨九重，内外郁郁，如云雾之烟也。 毕，叩齿九通，咽液九过，祝曰： 坚玉大君，来入骨中，身披素衣，头巾白冠，字凝羽珠，灌养九门，左佩龙书，右带金真，口吐白气，固骨凝筋，白骨不朽，筋亦不泯，百节生华，使我飞仙。 毕，夜半生气时，复一行之。 九真日也，帝君太一五神，自然混化，立为一大神，不复待兆先思存，而后为结变也。 貌状并如婴儿之形，九真同法尔。 此是九魂七魄，化五神结凝，帝君九变，太一三斗同把符籍，定录玄清，使兆长生不死，上升仙庭者也。 此道幽秘，上灵所宝，非有仙籍者，不得闻也，非有宿契者，不得见也。 闻见之者，皆应运挺生，与灵合得，故冥感吉会，拔匠幽领，天神来过，玉华接盻，故九真坚心，八道悟观矣。 斯乃三元之合符，非陆行之所希也。 先陈盟誓，乃得宣焉。 第三真法，以四月本命日，及四月甲午、丁卯日巳时，帝君太一五神，混合化生大神。 大神又欻尔分形，为黄气郁郁，尽流入诸精血中，号曰元生君，字黄宁子玄。 巳时当入室，接手两膝上，闭气冥目内视，存见元生君，周游一身血脉精液之中，使口吐黄气，以缠熏孔脉之外，及一身九重，使内外并同黄气。 毕，叩齿九通，咽液九过，祝曰： 元生大君，同灌血躯，身披黄衣，头巾紫芙，左佩虎录，右带龙书，羽衣上披，威仪扶胥，口吐黄津，固血镇虚，真气日入，邪气消除，精盈液溢，九灵俱居，使我飞仙，天地同符。 毕，夜半生气时，又一施行。 第四真法，以六月甲辰日、本命日、戊寅日午时，帝君太一五神，变为一大神，来入在肝中，号曰青明君，字明轮童子。 至此日午时，当入室，接手於两膝上，闭气冥目内视，存青明大君入坐肝中，使口吐青气，以绕肝九重。 毕，叩齿九通，咽液九过，祝曰： 青明大君，来入我肝，身披青衣，头巾翠冠，左佩虎章，右带龙文，字为童子，宝真明轮，口吐青气，养肝导神，青藏自生，上为天仙，太一护精，抱魄检魂，帝君奉籍，使我得真。 毕，夜半生气时，复一行之。 第五真法，以七月三日，及本命日、庚午日巳时，帝君太一五神，混合化为一大神，在脾中，号曰养光君，字太仓子。 至此日时，兆入室，接手於两膝上，闭气冥目，内视注心，存养光君入坐脾中，使口吐绿气，以绕脾九重，气上冲泥丸中，内外洞彻郁郁。 毕，叩齿九通，咽液九过，祝曰： 养光大君，来入脾中，上灌三元，是为太仓，身披绿衣，头巾莲冠，左佩玉灵，右带威神，五灵秉钺，七电九震，口吐绿华，养脾滞魂，黄藏自生，上为真人。 毕，夜半生气时，复一行之。 第六真法，以八月十五日，及本命日、庚申日申时，帝君太一五神，混合化为一大神，在肺中，号曰上元素玉君，字梁南中童子。 至其日时也，兆当入室，接手於两膝上，闭气冥目内视，存上元素玉君入坐肺中，使口吐五色气，以绕肺九重，上彻泥丸中，内外郁然。

At this time, enter the chamber, place your hands upon your knees, hold your breath, close your eyes, and inwardly focus your vision. Visualize the *Firm Jade Lord*, whose name is *Congealed Feather Pearl*, entering and sitting within the throat’s gastric tube, transforming into white *qi* that permeates the hundred bones. Envision the great spirit exhaling white *qi* to encircle the bones ninefold, both within and without dense as misty clouds. When complete, click your teeth nine times, swallow your saliva nine times, and pray:

*"Firm Jade Great Lord, enter my bones,
Clad in plain robes, crowned with a white cap,
Your name, Congealed Feather Pearl, nourishes the nine gates.
Left bearing the Dragon Script, right adorned with Golden Perfection,
Exhaling white qi, strengthening bones and congealing sinews,
White bones never decay, sinews never dissolve,
A hundred joints bloom with blossoms, enabling me to fly as an immortal."*

When finished, repeat the practice at the midnight hour of *qi*-generation. On the ninth true day, the Supreme Lord and Great One’s five spirits naturally merge and transform, instantly becoming one great spirit, no longer requiring prior signs or visualization to complete the union. Its form resembles that of an infant, and the nine true methods follow the same pattern. This is the nine *hún* and seven *pò* transforming the five spirits into a congealed union, the Supreme Lord’s ninefold metamorphosis. The Great One and Three Dipper Stars together grasp the talismanic register, determining the mysterious and pure record, enabling the practitioner to attain long life without death and ascend to the immortal courts. This Dao is profound and secret, treasured by the highest spirits. Those without immortal registers may not hear of it; those without prior karmic affinity may not witness it. Those who hear or see it are born in accord with destiny, attaining union with the numinous. Thus, through hidden resonance and auspicious convergence, they are delivered from obscurity and comprehend the subtle. Heavenly spirits descend, jade blossoms greet their gaze, so the nine truths firm the heart, and the eight paths awaken insight. This is the union of the Three Origins’ talismans, not something sought by those who walk the earthly path. First, make a covenant oath, then may it be proclaimed.

The Third True Method: On the day of one’s life-star in the fourth month, or on an *jiǎ-wǔ* or *dīng-mǎo* day at the *sì* hour, the Supreme Lord and Great One’s five spirits merge and transform to generate a great spirit. This great spirit suddenly disperses its form, becoming a dense yellow *qi* that flows into all the essence and blood, named the *Primal Life Lord*, whose name is *Yellow Tranquility Master of Mystery*. At the *sì* hour, enter the chamber, place your hands upon your knees, hold your breath, close your eyes, and inwardly focus your vision. Visualize the *Primal Life Lord* circulating through the body’s blood vessels and essence-fluids, exhaling yellow *qi* to envelop and permeate the external pores and meridians, as well as the body’s ninefold layers, so that within and without are suffused with yellow *qi*. When complete, click your teeth nine times, swallow your saliva nine times, and pray:

*"Primal Life Great Lord, together irrigate this blood-body,
Clad in yellow robes, crowned with a purple lotus,
Left bearing the Tiger Record, right adorned with the Dragon Script,
Feathered robes draped above, majestic presence upheld,
Exhaling yellow essence, securing the blood and stabilizing the void,
True qi enters daily, evil qi dissolves,
Essence brims, fluids overflow, the nine numina all reside,
Enabling me to fly as an immortal, in harmony with Heaven and Earth."*

When finished, repeat the practice at the midnight hour of *qi*-generation.

The Fourth True Method: On an *jiǎ-chén* day, one’s life-star day, or a *wù-yín* day at the *wǔ* hour in the sixth month, the Supreme Lord and Great One’s five spirits transform into one great spirit, entering the liver, named the *Azure Clarity Lord*, whose name is *Luminous Wheel Youth*. On this day at the *wǔ* hour, enter the chamber, place your hands upon your knees, hold your breath, close your eyes, and inwardly focus your vision. Visualize the *Azure Clarity Great Lord* entering and sitting within the liver, exhaling azure *qi* to encircle the liver ninefold. When complete, click your teeth nine times, swallow your saliva nine times, and pray:

*"Azure Clarity Great Lord, enter my liver,
Clad in azure robes, crowned with a kingfisher cap,
Left bearing the Tiger Seal, right adorned with the Dragon Script,
Your name, Luminous Wheel Youth, treasured true clarity,
Exhaling azure qi, nourishing the liver and guiding the spirit,
The Azure Visceral Palace self-generates, ascending as a celestial immortal,
The Great One guards essence, embracing the *pò* and restraining the *hún*,
The Supreme Lord presents the register, enabling me to attain the true."*

When finished, repeat the practice at the midnight hour of *qi*-generation.

The Fifth True Method: On the third day of the seventh month, or on one’s life-star day or a *gēng-wǔ* day at the *sì* hour, the Supreme Lord and Great One’s five spirits merge and transform into one great spirit within the spleen, named the *Nurturing Radiance Lord*, whose name is *Great Granary Master*. At this time, the practitioner enters the chamber, places their hands upon their knees, holds their breath, closes their eyes, and inwardly focuses their vision. Visualize the *Nurturing Radiance Lord* entering and sitting within the spleen, exhaling green *qi* to encircle the spleen ninefold, the *qi* ascending to the *Mud Pill Palace*, within and without thoroughly suffused. When complete, click your teeth nine times, swallow your saliva nine times, and pray:

*"Nurturing Radiance Great Lord, enter my spleen,
Irrigating the Three Origins above, this is the Great Granary,
Clad in green robes, crowned with a lotus cap,
Left bearing Jade Numinosity, right adorned with Majestic Spirit,
The Five Numinous hold axes, seven lightning bolts and nine thunderclaps,
Exhaling green blossoms, nourishing the spleen and settling the *hún*,
The Yellow Visceral Palace self-generates, ascending as a perfected one."*

When finished, repeat the practice at the midnight hour of *qi*-generation.

The Sixth True Method: On the fifteenth day of the eighth month, or on one’s life-star day or a *gēng-shēn* day at the *shēn* hour, the Supreme Lord and Great One’s five spirits merge and transform into one great spirit within the lungs, named the *Upper Origin Plain Jade Lord*, whose name is *Liáng of the Southern Center Youth*. At this time, the practitioner enters the chamber, places their hands upon their knees, holds their breath, closes their eyes, and inwardly focuses their vision. Visualize the *Upper Origin Plain Jade Lord* entering and sitting within the lungs, exhaling five-colored *qi* to encircle the lungs ninefold, ascending to the *Mud Pill Palace*, within and without dense and luminous.

chunks.original_text: 毕，叩齿九通，咽液九过，祝曰： 上元大君，来坐肺中，三天梁南，灵华中童子，身披龙衣，黄晨华冠，右把皇籍，帝君同轮，太一把图，右执灵篇，左佩玄书，右带虎文，口吐五气。 时复一行之#1。 第七真法，以九月十九日，及本命日、戊戌日酉时，帝君太一五神，混合化为一大神，忽尔又因分形为二神，分坐散形在两肾中，号曰玄阳君，字冥光先生。 至此日时，兆当入室，接手於两膝上，冥目闭气内视，存玄阳君化形，并入两肾中，使口吐苍气，以绕肾九重，上冲泥丸，内外郁然。 毕，叩齿九通，咽液九过，祝曰： 玄阳帝君，入坐肾中，身披紫衣，头巾扶晨，左佩龙符，右带凤文，冥光先生，常在帝前，口吐苍华，灌肾灵根，太上徘徊，上迎帝君，下籍书我名绅，黑藏自生，身为飞仙，北登玄阙，游行天关，高步上虚，携手五神。 毕，夜半生气时，复一行之。 第八真法，以十月十二日，及本命日、辛巳日午时，帝君太一五神，混合变化为一大神，在胆中，号曰含景君，字北台玄精。 至其日时也，兆当入室，接手於两膝上，闭气冥目内视，存含景君入坐於胆中，使口吐五色气，绕胆九重，上冲泥丸，云雾内外，通匝郁然也。 毕，叩齿九通，咽液九过，祝曰： 含景大君，来坐胆中，身披锦衣，头戴紫冠，北台玄精，化生灵烟，左佩神光，右带玉真，口吐五炁，养胆强身，上帝三命，与我结亲，桃君记符，太一七陈，和精宝血，理液固筋，使我上升，得为飞仙，北朝虚皇，乘軿三元。 毕，夜半生气时，复一行之。 第九真法，以十一月二十八日，及本命日、丙子日巳时，帝君大一五神，混合变化为一大神，在泥丸紫房之中，号曰帝昌上皇君，字先灵元泉。 此神者，是帝君之父祖，故自九化混魂，反形於祖父，以降於上宫也。 定名仙书，解结胞中，胞中之节，非祖无以散化，非父无以披根，非帝无以正魂，故须祖父来营，定形神以长存也。 兆每至其日时，当沐浴，烧香左右，入室平坐，接手於两膝上，存帝昌上皇君在泥丸紫房之中，使口吐紫气，绕头九重。 毕，又使口吐紫气，绕两目内外九重。 毕，又使口吐紫气，绕舌九重。 毕，又使口吐紫气，绕齿九重。 毕。 凡四九三十六绕气，使一身内外，都郁然洞彻，如日在身内之状也。 都毕，叩齿三十六通，咽液三十六过，祝曰： 帝昌祖君，帝皇元神，镇守紫房，宫在泥丸，黄阙金室，混为九魂，魂生万变，乃成帝君，五神奉侍，七气上真，龙衣凤帔，紫翠青缘，手把皇符，头巾华冠，左佩玉瑛，右带虎文，下坐日月，口吐紫烟，周气齿舌，朝溉眼唇，出丹入虚，呼魄召魂，凝精固胎，六合长欢，上登太微，列补仙官。 夫一年之中，九真之道毕矣。 周而复始，则泥丸领灵，目童明全，五藏自生，血脉保津。 若身未升登，合形俱晨者，则宜翳景示俗，暂入太阴也。 身经三官者，三官不得犯也。 则九真召魄，太一守骸，三元护气、太一摄魂，骨肉不朽，五脏不陨，能死能生，能阴能阳，出虚入无，天地俱生。 是以道士清静营形，感致九真之气应也。 三元飞精以盈虚，太一抱我尸而反质，微乎深哉，微乎深哉。 子常修九真之道者，百神揖拜，万鬼受事。

chunks.original_text: 若经太阴，则形骸不朽，五脏自生，计二十四年，更得生焉。 豁尔而寤，了尔而觉，明明忆昔日之入太阴也，似一宿之睡卧耳。 怅然已在於棺椁之外，朗然已坐丘山之巅，斯乃九真之幽妙，帝君之极神也。 夫行此道者，欲得寡言静心，言不及死，正行不淫，语不及色。 又欲得惜气养神，起居安详，闭气使极，吐气使微，出虚入无，绵绵不绝，此所以帝君所栖，乃玄母之所亲，可以存五神，可以念九真也。 太上帝君九真宝符文 （原阙符） 右此符，常以八节日朱书服之。 太极真人曰：常当暗讽之，每至朔望旦及夜半，昤咏三过，以和九魂，复帝房之气，使人神正邪消，百关开朗，兆善秘宝，勿得妄宣，此所谓三天龙书者也。 太上九真作龙书，帝君神庭，以身为家，天尊朱室，明堂是居，正坐太极，玄丹不邪。 玄母所乘，三素之舆，元父所控，赤羽飞车，左御绛鸾，右辔灵乌，一寸正方，上灵共都，丹台火阙，流映散虚，高栖太微，手把紫录，灵渊素池，金醴水玉，九气徘徊，飞华云跃，中有大神，不可名目。 父驾元气，母载玄轴，巾日精华，腰带虎箓，流火万丈，眼生龙烛，天帝秉节，凤衣羽。 常存九真，神帝所育，乃在紫房，明堂之北，灌生续精，防守玄谷，出入命室，遨游洞关，时入中宫，上通太元，盘桓四气，九星判分，五藏坚华，太一守魂，寝息幽庭，役使七神，子能咏之，白日登晨。 精感妙对，摄御灵兽，山崩水溃，呼嗡响救，生地得时，上升天宿。 九真道毕，泄则祸遘，三官泄毒，考罚宣漏，当传仙才，审可成就。 中央黄老君八道秘言章 秘言微曰：闲心静室，寥朗虚真，逸想妙观，腾濯玄人，苟诚感上会，精悟晖晨，亦将得见丹景之气，三素飞云，八舆朱辇，紫霞琼轮，上清浮盼，徊辔三元，高皇秉节，灵童攀辕，太素拥盖，南极临轩，帝君守房，合景五神，七气续明，高晖远缠，冥光外映，蒙蔚龙颜，象烛太虚，流逸七观也。 子勤候之，立便飞仙，云轮忽降、则白日登晨，不烦复凝霜濯华，玄腴金丹也。 一道秘言曰：以立春日，正月甲乙日，清朝北望，有紫绿白云者，是为太上三元君三素飞云也。 其时三元君乘八舆之轮，上诣天皇太帝，子候见是三色云。 当心存叩头自搏，心存四再拜，自陈乞曰：曾孙某甲，少好道德，修行九真，沐浴五神，并为天帝、帝君所见记录，今日有幸，遇三元君出游，乞得侍给轮毂。 任意祈祝矣。 若三见元君之舆者，则白日升仙，不须复他存思，千百所施为也。 八道所行祝拜之辞，亦如此。 此所谓八道秘言者矣，非有仙录者不得闻也。 二道秘言曰：以春分之日，及寅卯日，夜半东北望，有玄青黄云者，是为太微天帝君三素云也。 其时太微天帝君乘八景之舆，上诣高上玉皇也。 见者心存拜祝，如上法。 若四见天帝之舆者，则白日有龙軿羽盖，来见迎而升天也。 三道秘言曰：以立夏之日，及甲子上旬戊辰、己巳之日，清旦西北望，有紫青黄云者，是为太极上真君三元内宫真人三素云也。 其时太极上真三元真人，乘玄景绿舆，上诣紫微宫。 心祝拜如上法。 若五见太极舆者，则白日升仙。 四道秘言曰：以夏至日，甲戌旬戊寅、己卯之日，清旦东南望，有赤白青云者，是为扶桑大帝君三素云也。

chunks.original_text: 其时扶桑公太帝君，乘光明八道之舆，上诣太微宫，见之心祝拜，如上法。 若四见之者，则白日有云龙见迎，而升天也。 五道秘言曰：以立秋之日，甲申上旬戊子、己丑之日，清旦正西望，见白赤紫云者，是为太素上真人天皇白帝君三素云也。 其时太素上真白帝君，乘翛条玉辇，上诣玉天玄皇高真也。 子当祝拜之，乞如上法也。 若五过见之，则白日升仙。 六道秘言曰：以秋分日，甲午上旬戊戌、己亥之日，清旦南望，有素赤黄云者，是为南极上真人上皇赤帝君三素云也。 其时南极上真赤帝君，乘绛琳碧辇，上诣阆风台，诣九灵夫人。 若见，当祝拜之，如上法也。 若四过见之，则白日升仙。 七道秘言曰：以立冬之日，及甲辰上旬戊申、己酉之日，清旦西南望，见绿紫青云者，是为上清真人帝君皇祖三素云也。 其时上清真人帝君皇祖，乘玄景八光丹舆，上诣高上九天玉帝。 子心祝与拜，如上法也。 若四见之者，则紫晨太一君乘凤文羽车，来迎於子，白日升晨。 八道秘言曰：以冬至之日，及甲寅上旬戊午、己未之日，清旦正东望，有朱碧黄云者，是为太霄玉妃太虚上真人三素云也。 其时太霄玉妃太虚上真人，乘徘徊玉辇，上诣太皇宫，召太微天帝君。 子见是云色者，拜祝请乞如上法。 若三见之者，玉皇命中黄司命，乘绛龙玉车来迎於子，白日升晨。 右八道秘言毕矣。 见者当心存叩头搏颊，四再拜，自陈如上法。 又当先沐浴烧香，以待其时，而心出望一食顷，而还室中。 三素云各自有色，色上下相沓积，如所次说也。 假令立春日见三元三素云者，则紫云在上，绿云次之，白云在下，共相杳也。 子谨视之。 上旬者，谓甲子之日，初入月十日之内，有甲子日是也。 非其日非其时，而见此云者，亦当拜祝，则三倍於其日时见也。 他日效於甲子矣。 凡行九真，司八道之事者，则天人卫护其形躯也，真皇守其命骨矣。 夫非有仙名玉籍者，幽冥亦不以此经示之，虽复希求，终不见也。 有见之者，皆玄书宿名，应为仙灵故也。 施行此道者，勿令人犯其履屣，并其巾褐衣服也。 履屣之类，常令新鲜，巾褐衣服，常令净洁，行此道也，无犯禁忌。 太素上清致帝君五神气法 常以戊己日鸡鸣时，闭目存东方青气大如弦，从日中来，使气满入头泥丸中。 又有两青烟，复从目中出，郁郁然，须臾变成二童子，上下衣青，如婴儿始行状也。 左目童子名曰帝君飞灵，右目童子名曰太乙晨婴，并在我之左右，侍兆之起居也。 极使仿髴，念之良久。 毕，叩齿九通，咽液九过，微祝曰： 东方五灵，日气焕青，帝君二童，欻然已生，旦入泥丸，炼脑宝形，左变右化，得道之名，使我上朝，太素紫清。 毕，极念二童子名，则百害不干。 此二童子乃玄母之魂魄，玄父之精神，故假帝君太一而名变，再以保兆魂，以正兆魄，魂魄保正，则一形常生矣。 若能修之十八年，白日升天也。 存两童子，令从目中出，使青气忽化，而生成也。 存在左右，令二童子各吐青气，以灌绕我一身，洞入内外也。 上清太上帝君九真中经卷上竟 #1『时』字上,当缺『毕夜半生气』五字 上清太上帝君九真中经卷下 太上玉晨郁仪奔日赤景玉文 太上玉晨结璘奔月黄景玉章

chunks.original_text: 右奔日月隐道，太上上清太极九皇四真人之所宝秘，玄虚元君之玉章也。 自非有金阁玉名，及绿字东华者，皆不闻见此二章之篇目矣。 行之者，先清斋百日，绝交人事，乃为之也。 久久行之，上奔日月，得给玉童玉女各十五人。 太上郁仪赤文、结璘黄章，乃太上玉帝君之灵秘篇也。 藏於九天之房，丹瑶之台，非勤心好真，宿有飞玄天仙之骨录者，莫能得而见闻也。 闻其篇目，皆不可妄言称及，犯者受考三官，天地不赦。 初令三百年，得宣传一人，却后七百年，乃复得传一人，若神真冥告有宜授者，传之也。 传授之法，皆师友相授，以崇玄科也。 七魄余气，变成龙虎，守人地关，伏於履屐之下。 三魂余神，化成五灵之云，映其巾中。 若有犯之者，则心震意惕，怅然自失，所以神亏魂散，精光翳滞也。 常当警备之，履屐之下，不令有土者，忌粪壤之气也； 衣服内外，不令有垢秽者，忌洿慢之熏也。 侍经有高上玉童玉女，各十七人，言此有经者之功过，摄万邪之不祥也。 若子视经，深入别室，烧香左右。 传授之时，对斋乃付。 按传授之法，各对斋静，以诚其心，思神研真，以壹其志。 今宝书有九真之事，及二十四神名字，存念祝说，皆灵言上音，故以重斋受之，始盟漏泄之考矣。 二人各共对斋二十四日，又告斋前后各一日，日讫出经，以付弟子。 弟子写毕，剪发束结，诣师以为效信。 今代用白绢九丈准盟，歃割之伤，用白素者，太素之炁也，用九丈者，九真数也。 受经以后，不得宣盟泄经，愆德毁正，多言失行，以秽道真。 遵修是经者，则白日登晨，违其约者，七祖受地狱考也。 上清紫精君、皇初紫灵道君，常内镇洞房，观盼九天，偃息华辰之下，寝晏九精之内，拘魂魄於北上，炼五神於真炁，逍遥八素，列名玄图。 太上太道君吟曰：上紫门，望八晨，列丹宫，具明神，游九气，舞天仙，巾天青，咏太历，带豁落，诵灵策，招飙龙，蹑双白，引紫童，徊二赤，藏太素，隐华壁。 此言是紫精三帝君，常致五神之道经也。 太历谓《七圣玄纪》，灵策谓《玉皇经》。 科曰：授非其人，不遵法度，为宣泄天文也。 漏慢违誓，死为下鬼，乃七祖考受风火之罪。 自非同气，宁当闭口。 西玄山洞台中，有此二经，刻以玉简，书以金字。 及王屋清虚天，皆有而不备具，唯太玄宫高上台，及蓬莱府北室金柱玉壁，刻文并备具也。 中宫仙人、太清诸官，并不知此经是何事也。 峨眉山北洞中石室户枢，刻石书字曰：郁仪引日精，结璘致月神，得道处上宫，位为帝君真。 凡二十字，下仙见之，台自不解。 欲行得此，不必愚贤，但地上无此文耳。 真官玄法，启誓乃传，有道而行，位为上真，乃乘八景琼轮，游行九晨，诣太素宫，见太一帝君，俱朝元晨。 故秘言曰：子得郁仪结璘，乃成上清之真，不修上道，不得见三元君。 太上郁仪日中五帝讳字服色 日中有青帝，讳圆常无，字照龙韬，衣青玉锦帔，苍华飞羽裙，首建翠蓉扶晨冠。 日中赤帝，讳丹灵峙，字绿虹映，衣绛玉锦帔，丹华飞羽裙，建丹扶灵明冠。 日中白帝，讳皓郁将，字回金霞，衣素玉锦帔，白羽飞华裙，建皓灵扶盖冠。 日中黑帝，讳澄增停，字玄录炎，衣玄玉锦帔，黑羽飞华裙，建玄山芙蓉冠。

chunks.original_text: 日中黄帝，讳寿逸峊，字飙晖像，衣黄玉锦帔，黄羽飞华裙，建扶灵紫蓉冠。 右日中五帝君讳字服色。 欲行奔日道，当祝识名字，存帝服色，在我之左右前后。 月中夫人之魂精内神，名暧萧台摽，右月中魂配五帝，次之又祝之。 能知月魂名，终身无灾，万害不伤。 太上藏日月帝君、夫人讳字於太素宫，有知之者神仙。 太上结璘月中五帝夫人讳字服色 月中青帝夫人，讳娥隐珠，字芬艳婴，衣青琼锦帔，翠龙凤文飞羽裙。 月中赤帝夫人，讳翳逸寥，字宛延虚，衣丹蕊玉锦帔，朱华凤络飞羽裙。 月中白帝夫人，讳灵素兰，字郁连华，衣白琳四出龙锦帔，素羽鸾章飞华裙。 月中黑帝夫人，讳结连翘，字淳属金，衣玄琅九道云锦帔，黑羽龙文飞华裙。 月中黄帝夫人，讳清荣襟，字炅定容，衣黄云山文锦帔，黄羽龙文飞华裙。 右五夫人头并颓云三角髻，余发垂之至腰。 右月中五帝夫人讳字服色。 欲行奔月之道，当祝识名字，存夫人服色，在己之左右前后。 日中五帝魂精内神，名珠景赤童，右日魂配月五夫人，次又存祝之。 能知日魂名，终身无疾，万祸不犯。 太上藏日月魂名於紫虚玉宫，有知之者，通神使灵。 存奔日月道者，任意所便行耳，不必尽为之也。 欲得静室隐止，唯令见日月之始晖处也。 若不绝人事，与外物相干者，不得行此道也。 夜半当烧香，存五帝、五帝夫人名字，心祝曰： 愿与帝君太一五神，合景如一。 於是二十四年，亦白日升天，亦不必行奔存之道也。 常存在我之左右，并心祝窃诵，勿令耳闻。 行郁仪奔日之道，旦旦视日初出之时，时无日当在静室，先临目闭气十息，因又咽日光晖十过，当存令日光霞，使入口即而吞之。 毕，微呼日中五帝君字，并月魂名，凡三过。 毕，阴祝曰： 愿得与五帝真君，月魂精神，共乘景云，上奔日宫。 又闭目，乃存青帝君，从日光中来下，在我之左； 次又存赤帝君，从日光中来，在我之右； 次又存白帝君，从日光中来，在我之背； 次又存黑帝君，从日光中来，在我之左手上； 次又存黄帝君，从日光中来，在我之右手上。 次五帝都来，存帝服色，令仿髴。 於是又叩齿五通，咽液九过，微祝曰： 赤炉丹景，圆华九明，太晖启晨，焕曜朱精，五帝肇霞，映洞万生，观落上真，空洞条平，运气炼彩，流荡五形，使我神化，六府敷盈，同与帝君，太一无英，骖乘绛云，阳遂九軿，上奔日官，与帝合灵，寿均天地，二晨相倾。 毕，又叩齿三通，咽液三过，微祝曰： 月魂精神，暧萧台摽，使我得到，日窟之天，东蒙长丘，得受挥神之章，带九有之符，食青精日，饮云碧之腴，宴八极之城，登明真之台，坐希林之殿，咏玉晨之辞。 毕，又存阳遂绛云之车，驾九赤龙，从日光中来到我之前，仍存与五帝共乘，而奔日也。 自忘形良久，又咽液十四过讫，乃开目极念，存思自有仿髴。 能久行此道者，必得乘景奔日，此郁仪之道毕矣。 行结璘奔月之道，夕夕视月初出之时，无月者，於静室中，先临目闭气九息，因又咽月光九过，当存月光，使入我口中，即而吞之。 毕，微祝五帝夫人讳字，并日魂名，凡三过。 乃存月中青帝夫人，从月光中来，在我左右，相次比如存日中五帝法。

Within the sun dwells the Yellow Emperor, whose taboo name is *Shòu Yì Fú*, whose courtesy name is *Biāo Huī Xiàng*, and who wears a robe of yellow-jade brocade, a skirt of yellow feathers and flying blossoms, and a crown of purple hibiscus and luminous splendor.

To the right: the taboo names, courtesy names, and attire of the Five Emperor Lords of the Sun.

Should one wish to practice the Way of Rushing to the Sun, one must invoke and recognize their names, visualize the emperors’ attire, and hold them in mind to the left and right, before and behind.

The spirit-soul of the Lady within the moon is named *Ài Xiāo Tái Biāo*. To the right: the moon’s soul is paired with the Five Emperors, and one must also invoke it. He who knows the name of the moon’s soul shall be free from calamity all his life, and no harm shall befall him.

The Most High conceals the taboo names and courtesy names of the Sun and Moon Emperor Lords and their Ladies within the Palace of Great Simplicity. He who knows them shall become a divine immortal.

The Most High binds the radiance of the Five Emperor Ladies of the Moon—here follow their taboo names, courtesy names, and attire:

Within the moon dwells the Lady of the Bluegreen Emperor, whose taboo name is *É Yǐn Zhū*, whose courtesy name is *Fēn Yàn Yīng*, and who wears a robe of azure-jade brocade, a skirt of flying feathers adorned with green dragon and phoenix patterns.

Within the moon dwells the Lady of the Red Emperor, whose taboo name is *Yì Yì Liáo*, whose courtesy name is *Wǎn Yán Xū*, and who wears a robe of cinnabar-stamen jade brocade, a skirt of crimson blossoms and phoenix-net flying feathers.

Within the moon dwells the Lady of the White Emperor, whose taboo name is *Líng Sù Lán*, whose courtesy name is *Yù Lián Huá*, and who wears a robe of white jade brocade with four-emerging dragons, a skirt of white feathers and simurgh-patterned flying blossoms.

Within the moon dwells the Lady of the Black Emperor, whose taboo name is *Jié Lián Qiáo*, whose courtesy name is *Chún Shǔ Jīn*, and who wears a robe of dark jade brocade with nine-layered cloud patterns, a skirt of black feathers and dragon-patterned flying blossoms.

Within the moon dwells the Lady of the Yellow Emperor, whose taboo name is *Qīng Róng Jīn*, whose courtesy name is *Jiǒng Dìng Róng*, and who wears a robe of yellow cloud-and-mountain-patterned brocade, a skirt of yellow feathers and dragon-patterned flying blossoms.

To the right: the Five Ladies all wear their hair in three-cornered cloud buns, with the rest falling loose to their waists.

To the right: the taboo names, courtesy names, and attire of the Five Emperor Ladies of the Moon.

Should one wish to practice the Way of Rushing to the Moon, one must invoke and recognize their names, visualize the Ladies’ attire, and hold them in mind to the left and right, before and behind.

The spirit-soul of the Five Emperors within the sun is named *Zhū Jǐng Chì Tóng*. To the right: the sun’s soul is paired with the Five Ladies of the Moon, and one must also visualize and invoke it. He who knows the name of the sun’s soul shall be free from illness all his life, and no misfortune shall befall him.

The Most High conceals the names of the sun and moon souls within the Purple Void Jade Palace. He who knows them shall commune with spirits and command the numinous.

For those who practice the Way of Rushing to the Sun and Moon, one may proceed as one finds convenient and need not perform all the rites. Should one desire a secluded chamber, one must only ensure that the first radiance of the sun or moon is visible. If one does not sever worldly affairs and remains entangled with external matters, one cannot practice this Way.

At midnight, one must burn incense, visualize the names of the Five Emperors and the Five Emperor Ladies, and silently pray: *"May I unite with the Emperor Lords and the Five Spirits of the Great One, merging our radiance as one."*

Thus, after twenty-four years, one shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight, and there is no need to practice the Way of Rushing and Visualization. One must constantly hold them in mind to the left and right, silently invoking and reciting without letting the ears hear.

To practice the Way of *Yù Yí* and rush to the sun: at dawn, gaze upon the moment the sun first emerges. If there is no sun, remain in a secluded chamber, first close the eyes, hold the breath for ten cycles, then swallow the sun’s radiant light ten times. One must visualize the sun’s light and mist entering the mouth and swallow it. When finished, softly call the courtesy names of the Five Emperor Lords of the Sun and the name of the moon’s soul three times in all. Then silently pray: *"May I, together with the True Lords of the Five Emperors and the spirit-soul of the moon, ascend upon radiant clouds to the Sun Palace."*

Next, close the eyes and visualize the Bluegreen Emperor Lord descending from the sun’s light to one’s left; then visualize the Red Emperor Lord descending from the sun’s light to one’s right; then visualize the White Emperor Lord descending from the sun’s light to one’s back; then visualize the Black Emperor Lord descending from the sun’s light to one’s left hand; then visualize the Yellow Emperor Lord descending from the sun’s light to one’s right hand. When all Five Emperors have arrived, visualize their attire, making it as vivid as possible. Then knock the teeth five times, swallow the saliva nine times, and softly pray:

*"Crimson furnace, cinnabar radiance,
Round blossom, ninefold brightness,
Great light dawns, morning’s splendor,
Resplendent with vermilion essence.
Five Emperors rise in mist,
Illuminating the myriad beings of the cavernous void.
Behold the Perfected of the Upper Realms,
Empty and boundless, harmonious and level.
Circulating qi refines the hues,
Flowing through the five forms.
May my spirit transform,
My six palaces flourish and fill,
Uniting with the Emperor Lords,
The Great One and the Peerless Flower.
Riding crimson clouds,
Ascending the nine chariots of the Yang Path,
Rushing to the Sun Palace,
Merging with the Emperors in spirit.
May my life span equal heaven and earth,
The two dawns inclining toward one another."*

When finished, knock the teeth three times, swallow the saliva three times, and softly pray:

*"Spirit-soul of the moon,
Ài Xiāo Tái Biāo,
May I reach
The Heaven of the Sun’s Cavern,
The eastern Mount Meng of the long hills,
Receive the writ of the Waving Spirit,
Bear the talisman of the Nine Realms,
Feast on the azure essence of the sun’s grain,
Drink the rich jade of cloudy azure,
Dwell in the city of the eight poles,
Ascend the Terrace of Bright Perfection,
Sit in the Hall of Rare Forest,
Chant the verses of the Jade Dawn."*

When finished, visualize the crimson chariot of the Yang Path, drawn by nine red dragons, arriving from the sun’s light before you. Then visualize ascending with the Five Emperors to rush to the sun. Forget the body for a long while, then swallow the saliva fourteen times, open the eyes, and concentrate the mind, visualizing as vividly as possible. He who practices this Way for a long time shall surely ride the radiance to the sun. Thus ends the Way of *Yù Yí*.

To practice the Way of *Jié Lín* and rush to the moon: at dusk, gaze upon the moment the moon first emerges. If there is no moon, remain in a secluded chamber, first close the eyes, hold the breath for nine cycles, then swallow the moon’s light nine times. One must visualize the moon’s light entering the mouth and swallow it. When finished, softly invoke the taboo names and courtesy names of the Five Emperor Ladies and the name of the sun’s soul three times in all. Then visualize the Lady of the Bluegreen Emperor descending from the moon’s light to one’s left and right, following the same method as visualizing the Five Emperors of the Sun.

chunks.original_text: 都来，存服色极令仿髴。 於是叩齿九通，咽液九过，微祝曰： 黄精启晖，元阴内彰，映观太玄，开洞万方，散蔚寒飙，七晨悬琅，回阴三合，天地吐光，紫晖旋结，浮华九空，圆明赋彩，六气化通，五帝夫人，蹑云把风，灵帔郁罗，佩琼带珰，羽裙拂霄，逸虚扇东，骞树敷晨，盖条秀蓬，云蟇炼摩，扶养木王，洞根万里，荫遏吾躬，魂和神化，六玄虚充，还老归婴，玉映反童，帝君合化，并景桃康，时乘流铃，飞云十龙，上奔明月，位为仙皇，寿合二象，天地无穷。 毕，又叩齿九通，咽液七过，又微祝曰： 日魂精神，珠景赤童，使我西到，六领之门，入协晨玉宫，八纮素丘八景上房，得带千明之符，佩流星夜光之章，坐太和之殿，登七灵之台，饮月华云膏，食黄琬紫津之，咏高上之篇，吟玉晨真辞。 毕，又存流铃飞云之车，驾十黄龙，来从月光中到我之前，仍存与五帝夫人，共乘而奔月也。 自忘形良久，又咽液三十过讫，乃闭目极念，存思自有仿髴。 能久行此道者，必得乘景奔月，此结璘之道毕矣。 若已得仙道，又备炼精思者，二年存之，便有仿髴，三年形见，五年行之，得奔日月也。 自非已成仙人，始欲精思者，故为不速。 能久修之，上属二景，得为上清真人。 太上八景四蕊紫浆五珠绛生神丹方经序 一名三华飞纲丹经 张道陵撰并注 太上真人，所以广盼众天，豁落紫空，宴观七觉，游翔万方，寔由四液之飞津，五珠之丹皇矣。 遂乘三华以八盼，御飞刚以保真，分神易景，逍遥上清者也。 兆睹琅玕之华，则绛生之丹立焉。 既获九真之高章，而九阴之户启矣。 长年在於玄览，得道在乎精微。 精微所宜，澹质妙绥，注神真气，栖心冥机，澄五神於紫房，镜混合於太微，月华合於结璘，日晖洞於郁仪，灵变朗於九晨。 挹凝液以虚飞，玉经唱於明景，焕龙华於扶希，眇眇奔乎冥汉，天地欻以推移，立变分於圆涂，电散疾於震雷，居洪渊而不溺，践兵刃而不危。 将塞也，则万路楗闭； 欲通也，则积滞荡开。 沉扇无方，随意所宜，大哉灵化之丹，与帝一九阴齐其光晖。 服尽一剂，后三光而不衰。 太上八景四蕊紫浆五珠绛生神丹方经 第一、绛陵朱儿七斤。 口诀是丹砂，巴越之精明上者。 第二、丹山日魂四斤。 口诀是雄黄，取精鲜色好，洞明上者。 第三、玄台月华三斤。 口诀是雌黄，不用青色。 第四、青腰玉女五斤。 口诀是空青。 第五、灵华沉腴三斤。 口诀是熏陆香。 第六、北帝玄珠一斤。 口诀是消石。 第七、紫陵文候五两。 口诀是石英，精好者。 第八、东桑童子七两。 口诀是青木香。 第九、白素飞龙八两。 口诀是白石英。 第十、明玉神珠七两。 口诀是琥珀，拾芥者。 第十一、五精金羊五两。 口诀是阳起石。 第十二、两华飞英五两。 口诀是云母，取光明白好者。 此物有种五，各异名。 第十三、流丹白膏九两。 口诀是胡粉。 第十四、亭炅独生六两。 口诀是鸡舌香，取味辛者。 第十五、碧陵文候五两。 口诀是石黛。 第十六、倒行神骨五两。 口诀是戎盐。 第十七、白虎脱齿四两。 口诀是金牙石。 第十八、九灵黄童三两。 口诀是石硫黄。 第十九、陆虚遗生五两。 口诀是龙骨，舐之附舌者佳。 第二十、威文中王六两。

Having completed this, visualize the colors with utmost vividness. Then strike the teeth nine times, swallow saliva nine times, and softly invoke:

*"Yellow essence unfurls its radiance,
Primal yin inwardly manifests.
Reflecting upon the Great Mystery,
It opens the caverns of ten thousand directions.
Scattering the luxuriant chill of the whirlwind,
Seven dawns suspend their jade-like brilliance.
The threefold convergence of yin returns,
Heaven and Earth exhale their light.
Purple radiance spirals and coalesces,
Floating blossoms fill the nine voids.
Round luminosity bestows its hues,
The six qi transform and interflow.
The Five Emperor Ladies,
Treading clouds and grasping winds,
Wear spirit veils of dense silk,
Adorned with jade pendants and earrings.
Feathered skirts brush the heavens,
Wafting through the void to fan the east.
The soaring tree unfolds the dawn,
Its canopy branches lush as the sacred feng.
Cloud toads refine and polish,
Nurturing the Wood King.
The cavernous root spans ten thousand miles,
Its shade enfolding my body.
Soul harmonized, spirit transformed,
The six mysteries fill the void.
Returning from old age to infancy,
Jade-like luster restores youth.
The Imperial Lord merges and transforms,
Joining the radiant peach of health.
Timely riding the flowing bell,
Ten dragons of flying clouds,
Ascend to the bright moon.
Attaining the rank of Immortal Sovereign,
Lifespan unites with the two symbols,
Heaven and Earth without end."*

Finished, strike the teeth nine times again, swallow saliva seven times, and softly invoke:

*"Spirit of the sun’s soul,
Pearl-like radiance of the Crimson Youth,
Enable me to reach the west,
To the Gate of the Six Peaks.
Entering the Jade Palace of Harmonious Dawn,
The Eight Vastnesses and the White Mound,
The Upper Chamber of Eightfold Radiance,
Obtain the talisman of Thousandfold Clarity,
Wear the insignia of the Flowing Star and Night’s Brilliance.
Sit in the Hall of Supreme Harmony,
Ascend the Terrace of the Seven Numinous Ones.
Drink the moon’s essence and cloud’s cream,
Feast on the yellow jade and purple nectar.
Chant the verses of the Loftiest,
Recite the true hymns of the Jade Dawn."*

Finished, visualize the carriage of the flowing bell and flying clouds, drawn by ten yellow dragons, arriving from the moon’s light before you. Then visualize riding together with the Five Emperor Ladies to rush toward the moon.

Forgetting the form for a long while, swallow saliva thirty times, then close the eyes and concentrate the mind, visualizing as vividly as possible. He who practices this Way for a long time shall surely ride the radiance to the moon. Thus ends the Way of *Jié Lín*.

If one has already attained the Dao and further refines essence through visualization, practicing for two years will yield faint manifestations; in three years, the form will appear; in five years, one may ride the radiance to the sun and moon. For those who are not yet immortals but begin to refine their essence with precision, progress will not be swift. Through prolonged cultivation, ascending to the Twofold Radiance, one may become a Perfected of the Highest Clarity.

**Preface to the Scripture of the Divine Elixir of the Eightfold Radiance, Fourfold Blossom Purple Essence, and Fivefold Pearl Cinnabar**
*Also titled: Scripture of the Threefold Flower Flying Net Elixir*
*Composed and annotated by Zhang Daoling*

The Perfected of the Highest Lord,
So vast their gaze encompasses the heavens,
Traversing the boundless purple void,
Feasting upon the seven awakenings,
Roaming the ten thousand directions—
All this is made possible by the flying essence of the four fluids
And the cinnabar sovereign of the five pearls.
Thus they ride the threefold flower with eightfold vision,
Command the flying刚 to preserve their authenticity,
Dissolve the spirit and shift the radiance,
Wandering freely in the Highest Clarity.

When the sprout of langgan jade is beheld,
The cinnabar of crimson birth arises therein.
Having attained the lofty insignia of the Nine Perfected,
The gates of the nine yin unfold.
Longevity resides in the mysterious vision,
Attainment of the Dao lies in the subtle and profound.
What befits the subtle and profound?
A tranquil essence and wondrous serenity,
Infusing the spirit with true qi,
Settling the heart in the obscure mechanism.
Clarifying the five spirits in the purple chamber,
Mirroring the primordial harmony in the Great Tenuity.
Moon’s essence conjoins with *Jié Lín*,
Sun’s radiance penetrates *Yù Yí*,
Spiritual transformations gleam in the nine dawns.
Drawing the congealed fluid to soar in emptiness,
The Jade Scripture chants in luminous radiance,
Dragon flowers bloom in the rarefied,
Fleeting as they rush through the dark Han.
Heaven and Earth suddenly shift,
Standing transformations divide the round path.
Lightning scatters swiftly as thunder quakes,
Dwelling in the vast abyss yet not drowning,
Treading upon blades yet unharmed.
When obstruction is desired,
Ten thousand paths are bolted shut;
When passage is desired,
Stagnations dissolve and open.
Boundless and formless,
Adapting to every intent—
Great indeed is the numinous transformation of the elixir,
Its splendor equal to the Imperial Unity and the nine yin.
Consuming a single dose,
One outshines the Three Radiant Ones without decline.

These twenty-four ingredients combine the *qi* of the twenty-four spirits and harmonize the congealed essences of the nine dawns and nine yins, coalescing the luminous radiance of the sun and moon. Each is to be pounded separately, beginning with cinnabar, each for four thousand strokes. The ingredients must be of the highest purity and brilliance. The one who pounds the medicine should be temperate and discreet, avoiding idle chatter. They must first observe a thirty-day fast, and only after its completion proceed to pound the ingredients in a secluded chamber, wearing clean garments and bathing daily with fragrant waters.

Only three or four individuals may assist in compounding the medicine, all of like mind and purpose, dwelling in seclusion. The prohibitions and observances are identical to those of the fasting rituals. Once each ingredient has been pounded separately, place them into the cauldron in the following order: first cinnabar, then realgar, followed by orpiment, then malachite, next frankincense, and finally *Taiyi* remnant nourishment, which rests atop all the others. After all twenty-four ingredients are arranged in sequence within the cauldron, press them down lightly with a small willow spatula to ensure even distribution.

Next, slowly pour five *jin* of mercury over the ingredients until all are submerged. Then carefully place the upper earthen cauldron atop the lower one, sealing the seam with yellow cinnabar clay. Coat the outer edge with oyster-shell clay to a thickness of one *cun*, and allow it to dry in the shade for ten days. Once dry and cracked, apply another layer of clay. Afterward, coat the entire exterior—top, bottom, and sides—with oyster-shell clay to a uniform thickness of six *fen*.

First prepare the Six-One Clay to seal the inner and outer surfaces of the cauldron. The method for making this clay is as follows: use left-facing oysters from the Eastern Sea, halite, yellow cinnabar, talc, red halloysite, and earthworm-yellow soil—six ingredients in equal parts. Grind them finely and sift through fine silk. Mix with hundred-day-aged bitter wine until extremely sour. After blending, pound the mixture thirty thousand times to complete the Six-One Clay.

Apply this clay to the inner and outer surfaces of the two cauldrons in thin layers, allowing each to dry in the sun before adding the next. Once all layers are applied, ensure the clay is two and a half *cun* thick both inside and outside the cauldron.

Prepare sufficient Six-One Clay for the task. All clay mixtures should be blended with bitter wine. If halite is unavailable, salt from Hedong may be substituted. Additionally, mix two *dou* of fine Eastern Sea salt into one *hu* of bitter wine, strain to remove dregs, and use this solution to blend the Six-One Clay, following this proportion.

Choose a secluded location and build a kiln house forty *chi* in length, oriented south. Install a door at the eastern end, and a gauze window on the southern side. Construct the kiln at the center of the house, ensuring it is square with openings on all four sides. Place a large iron frame with four legs at the kiln’s center, positioned so that the upper and lower sections are appropriately spaced, with height adjustments made as needed for stability. Securely place the cauldron containing the medicine atop this frame.

Burn fine chaff beneath the cauldron, maintaining a distance of approximately one *chi* from the bottom. Regulate the fire carefully to avoid excessive intensity. After eighteen days, reduce the fire’s distance to five *cun* below the cauldron and continue for nine more days. Once complete, further reduce the distance to three *cun* and burn for seven days. Then bring the fire to within one *cun* of the cauldron for five days. Next, position the fire directly beneath the cauldron’s base for twenty-seven days. Afterward, raise the fire to the lower half of the cauldron’s belly for thirty days. Finally, adjust the fire to two *cun* below the upper cauldron for twenty-four days.

The flower will manifest in the colors of luminous clouds, its fifty-eight varieties of *qi* flowing like rosy dawn, its purple light resplendent and ineffable—this is called the Eight Radiant Four-Petal Five-Pearl Crimson-Born Spirit Elixir.

On the first day of the second or eighth lunar month at dawn, face the direction of the Year-Star, bow twice, and ingest one *liang* with east-flowing water. Immediately, nine dawn lights will sprout from your head, your face will bear jade-like radiance, and your flight will mirror the brilliance of precious constellations. A whistle to the left will cause immortals to bow in reverence, while a whistle to the right will unite the Eight Radiant Ones in harmony. If the medicinal flower has not fully formed, reseal the cauldron’s seams with clay as before, ensuring tightness, and burn the cauldron’s belly for sixty days—success will be assured. Cool for seven days before opening as initially described.

Consume one *ge* daily, and your lifespan will equal that of heaven and earth.
